errors.csrfError: An unexpected error occurred. Please reload the page and try again

modal.description: The application has encountered an unknown error and it is now in an inconsistent state. If you think that this is an error on our side please help us improve your experience by sending an error report on our <1>GitHub issues page</1>. Closing this dialog will bring you back to the home page.

default.title: ParallelCluster Manager
default.description: Quickly and easily create HPC cluster in AWS using ParallelCluster Manager. This UI uses the AWS ParallelCluster API to Create, Update and Delete Clusters as well as access, view logs, and build Amazon Machine Images (AMI's).

sshcommand.label: SSH Command
sshcommand.tooltiptext: Command to SSH into the HeadNode. If the keypair you used to create the HeadNode isn't default, you'll need to specify the path to the keypair. See <0>Connect to your Linux instance using an SSH Client</0> for more info.

ec2InstanceConnect.label: EC2 Instance Connect
ec2InstanceConnect.help: This copies the command to connect to the HeadNode using <0>EC2 Instance Connect</0>. You will need to <1>install mSSH helper</1> locally before running this command.

dialogs.delete: Are you sure you want to delete cluster {{clusterName}}?

splitPanel.preferencesPositionDescription: Choose the default split panel position for the service.
splitPanel.selectClusterText: Select a cluster to see its details

costEstimate.title: Cost Estimate
costEstimate.help: This cost estimate is based on the time the job took, the number of nodes and an estimate of the node cost. It could be inaccurate and is just meant to be an overall estimate.

validation.cannotBeBlank: Cluster name must not be blank.
validation.alreadyExists: Cluster with name {{clusterName}} already exists. Please choose a unique name.
validation.doesntMatchRegex: Cluster name '{{clusterName}}' doesn't match the format /^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9-]+$/. Please choose a name consisting of only upper and lower-case letters, numbers and dashes.
validation.specifySourceCopy: You must select a cluster to copy from.

clusterName.label: Cluster Name
clusterName.description: Please choose an identifier for this cluster. It is suggested to be lower-case and without spaces (e.g. my-cluster)).

configurationSource.label: Configuration Source
configurationSource.description: Please choose the source configuration for the cluster you want to create.

wizard.label: Wizard
wizard.description: Choose this to start a new cluster configuration.

template.label: Template
template.description: Choose this to use the wizard starting from an existing configuration or template file. This will proceed through the wizard process to allow you to customize any options before creating the cluster.

cluster.label: From Cluster
cluster.description: Use an existing cluster as a starting point for the configuration of your new cluster. Only clusters whose version matches the version of Pcluster Manager can be selected.

file.label: Upload a file
file.description: Choose this if you already have a file you wish to upload. This will proceed directly to the creation step.

validation.customAmiSelect: You must select an AMI ID if you enable Custom AMI.

region.label: Region
region.description: Region where the cluster will be created.

os.label: Operating System
os.description: OS installed on the cluster nodes.

vpc.label: VPC
vpc.description: VPC where the cluster instances will reside.

multiuser.title: Multi User
multiuser.label: Multi User Cluster
multiuser.description: Enable Multi-User cluster through Active Directory integration.

validation.selectInstanceType: You must select an instance type.
validation.setRootVolumeSize: You must set a RootVolume size.
validation.rootVolumeMinimum: You must use an integer >= 35GB for Root Volume Size.
validation.scriptWithArgs: You must specify a script path if you specify args.

Dcv.label: Virtual Desktop
Dcv.description: Allow a virtual desktop session on the HeadNode via DCV. If you select this option, we suggest using a larger instance size.
Dcv.help: Remote-Desktop into the headnode to visualize results.

Ssm.title: Virtual Console
Ssm.label: Remote Console Enabled
Ssm.description: Allow connecting to HeadNode via SSM.
Ssm.help: This setting will enable SSM which permits connecting to the head node via a virtual console.

keypair.label: Keypair
keypair.description: Keypair used to connect to HeadNode via SSH. If you don't specify an SSH keypair you can still connect to the cluster using SSM, make sure to turn on 'Remote Console' in order to do so.

imdsSecured.label: IMDS Secured
imdsSecured.help: If enabled, restrict access to IMDS (and thus instance credentials) to users with superuser permissions. For more information, see <0>How instance metadata service version 2 works in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux Instances.

securityGroups.label: Additional Security Groups
securityGroups.help: Provides additional security groups for the HeadNode.

validation.scaledownIdleTimeLessThanOne: Scaledown idle time should be at least 1 minute

validation.volumeSize: You must specify a valid Volume Size.

lustreType.label: FSx Lustre Type
lustreType.help: Choose SCRATCH_1 and SCRATCH_2 deployment types when you need temporary storage and shorter-term processing of data. The SCRATCH_2 deployment type provides in-transit encryption of data and higher burst throughput capacity than SCRATCH_1. Choose PERSISTENT_2 deployment type for longer-term storage and workloads and encryption of data in transit, choose PERSISTENT_1 only for backwards compatibility. See <0>DeploymentType</0>.

import.label: Import Path
import.help: Set Import Path to read files into your filesystem from an S3 bucket. See <0>ImportPath</0>.

export.label: Export Path
export.help: Set Export Path to write files from your filesystem into an S3 bucket. See <0>ExportPath</0>.

throughput.label: Per Unit Storage Throughput
throughput.help: Describes the amount of read and write throughput for each 1 tebibyte of storage, in MB/s/TiB. See <0>PerUnitStorageThroughput</0>.

compression.label: Compress Filesystem Data?
compression.help: When data compression is enabled, Amazon FSx for Lustre automatically compresses newly written files before they are written to disk and automatically uncompresses them when they are read. See <0>DataCompressionType</0>.

encrypted.label: Encrypted
encrypted.title: Encryption
encrypted.help: Specifies a custom AWS KMS key to use for encryption. See <0>EFS Encryption.</0>

provisioned.label: Provisioned Throughput
provisioned.help: Defines the provisioned throughput (from 1-1024 in MiB/s) of the Amazon EFS file system. If not provided filesystem will be created in 'bursting' mode. See <0>ThroughputMode section.</0>

encrypted.label: Encrypted
encrypted.title: Encryption
encrypted.help: Specifies a custom AWS KMS key to use for encryption. See <0>EBS Encryption.</o>

snapshotId.label: Snapshot ID
snapshotId.help: Specifies the Amazon EBS snapshot ID if you're using a snapshot as the source for the volume. See <0>SnapshotID</0>.

deletionPolicy.label: Deletion Policy
deletionPolicy.help: Specifies whether the volume should be retained, deleted, or snapshotted when the cluster is deleted. See <0>DeletionPolicy</0>.

mountPoint.label: Mount Point
mountPoint.help: Where to mount the shared storage on both the Head Node and Compute Fleet instances.

useExisting.label: Use Existing Filesystem
useExisting.help: Specify an existing fileystem and mount it to all instances in the cluster. See <0>FSx Filesystem ID</0>, <1>EFS Filesystem ID</1>, <2>EBS Volume ID</2>

validation.instanceTypeUnique: Instance types must be unique within a Queue.
validation.instanceTypeMissing: Select at least once instance type.
validation.selectSubnets: You must select at least one Subnet.
validation.setRootVolumeSize: You must set a RootVolume size.
validation.rootVolumeMinimum: You must use an integer >= 35GB for Root Volume Size.
validation.scriptWithArgs: You must specify a script path if you specify args.
validation.customAmiSelect: You must select an AMI ID if you enable Custom AMI.

container.title: Slurm Memory Settings
container.help: If enabled, users may use --mem to specify the amount of memory per node required by a job. For more information, see the <0>Slurm documentation for ConstrainRAMSpace

info.header: Slurm Memory Based Scheduling can be enabled if only one instance type is selected
info.body: If more than one instance type is selected in any queue, Slurm Memory Based Scheduling is disabled by default.

schedulableMemory.name: Schedulable Memory (MiB)
schedulableMemory.description: Amount of memory in MiB to be made available to jobs on the compute nodes of the compute resource
schedulableMemory.help: The default value is 95 % of the memory advertised by EC2.

domainName.name: Domain Name
domainName.description: The Active Directory (AD) domain that you use for identity information.
domainName.help: This property corresponds to the sssd-ldap parameter that's called ldap_search_base.

domainAddress.name: Domain Address
domainAddress.description: The URI or URIs that point to the AD domain controller that's used as the LDAP server.
domainAddress.help: The URI corresponds to the sssd-ldap parameter that's called ldap_uri. The value can be a comma separated string of URIs. To use LDAP, you must add ldap:// to the beginning of the each URI.

passwordSecretArn.name: Password Secret ARN
passwordSecretArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Secrets Manager secret that contains the DomainReadOnlyUser plaintext password.
passwordSecretArn.help: The content of the secret corresponds to SSSD-LDAP parameter that's called ldap_default_authtok.

domainReadOnlyUser.name: Domain Read Only User
domainReadOnlyUser.description: The identity that's used to query the AD domain for identity information when authenticating cluster user logins.
domainReadOnlyUser.help: It corresponds to sssd-ldap parameter that's called ldap_default_bind_dn. Use your AD identity information for this value.

caCertificate.name: CA Certificate
caCertificate.description: The absolute path to a certificates bundle containing the certificates for every certification authority in the certification chain that issued a certificate for the domain controllers.
caCertificate.help: It corresponds to the sssd-ldap parameter that's called ldap_tls_cacert.

requireCertificate.name: Require Certificate
requireCertificate.description: Specifies what checks to perform on server certificates in a TLS session.
requireCertificate.help: It corresponds to sssd-ldap parameter that's called ldap_tls_reqcert.

LDAPAccessFilter.name: LDAP Access Filter
LDAPAccessFilter.description: Specifies a filter to limit LDAP queries to a subset of the directory that's being queried.
LDAPAccessFilter.help: This property corresponds to the sssd-ldap parameter that's called ldap_access_filter. You can use it to limit queries to an AD that supports a large number of users.

generateSSHKeys.name: Generate SSH Keys
generateSSHKeys.description: Defines whether AWS ParallelCluster generates SSH key pairs for cluster users after they log in to the head node for the first time.
generateSSHKeys.help: The key pair is saved to the user home directory at /home/username/.ssh/. Users can use the SSH key pair for subsequent logins to the cluster head node and compute nodes. With AWS ParallelCluster, logins to cluster compute nodes are disabled by design. If a user hasn't logged into the head node, SSH keys aren't generated and the user won't be able to log in to compute nodes.

create.title: Cluster Configuration
create.description: This is the cluster configuration that will be used to {{action}} your cluster.
create.forceUpdate: Force Update: Enable this to perform an update while the ComputeFleet is still running.
create.disableRollback: Disable Rollback: Enable this to retain resources in the event of creation failure.

helpPanel.title: Custom AMI
helpPanel.description: Custom AMI's provide a way to customize the cluster. See the <0>Image section</0> of the documentation for more information.

size.label: Root Volume Size (GB)
size.description: Typically users will use a shared storage option for application data so a smaller root volume size is suitable. Blank will use the default from the AMI.

customImages.copyImageConfiguration: Image Configuration URL copied to clipboard.

ClusterFailedHelp.errorMessage: Stack failed to create, see <0>CloudFormation Stack Events</0> or <1>Cluster Logs</1> to see why.
